Antichrist has eleven characteristics. Whereas Christ is truth, he is a consummate liar, who instead of following Christ in his words and writings, his life and morals, does ex· actly the contrary, and instead of being Christ’s faithful Vicat, leads the people into temptation. Christ loves poverty; Anti· christ, treasures and worldly power. Christ left us the Bible as the sole source of all wisdom: Antichrist invents¹ new laws, which have no foundation in Scripture. Christ chose poor men despised by the world for His Apostles; the Pope chooses men of the greatest renown (though they are deceitful wretches) to be, as he supposes, the masters of the world. Christ commands llis disciples to preaeh the Gospel to the whole world3 the Pope, sitting on his· throne in his palace, like another Chosro'e‘S, despises this duty, end sends forth his menials to grow fat in stolen castles. Christ taught His Apostles to sustain persecu· tions and sufferings3 the Pope’s hirelings struggle and fight for temporal dominion. Christ forbade His followers to wield the swerd: the Pope pays his mercenary troops with the money of the poor. Christ refused to revenge Himself upon the Sama· ritans, who denied Him the necessarios of life; the Pope lays an interdict on those who resist his tyranny. Christ submitted to His judges; the Pope thrusts himself forward as the uni· versal judge. Christ concealed His Deity under a human form3 the Pope foists himself on the people as ademi-god, nay, as God, and no one is permitted to judge him. The Apostles, by Christ's own command, forbade any one to confer power for money; the Pope seizes upon all the fattest livings and gives them 10 his own people. All these are the deeds of Antichrist, deceiving Christemlom. There are also many sophistical argu· ments, which tend towards the same object.
